info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:08PM EST until January 08 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches with some locally higher amounts possible on the most favored west facing slopes. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southeast Webster, Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Sunday to midnight EST Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of light freezing drizzle will be possible overnight prior to switching over to snow Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
